Question: What is Version Control?
Option A: A free and open-source version control system.
Option C: The practice of tracking and managing changes to software code.
Option D: A platform for developers to create, share, and grow.

Question: Why was it preferable to execute Git commands on the command line in the past?
Option A: Because it was easier to use Gitlab
Option B: Because it allowed for automatic integration of changes into your working branch.
Option C: Because it provided complete freedom and flexibility to make necessary changes.

Question: What happens when Git encounters a piece of data that is changed in both histories?
Option B: It will create a new branch.
Option C: It will need user intervention to continue.
Option D: It will delete the conflicting changes.
